intro: Hoya vicencioana subsp. quezonensis, commonly known as the Quezon hoya, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and relatively easy care requirements. Hoya vicencioana subsp. quezonensis thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it suitable for indoor cultivation.
